subject: Re: [junit] What is the solution to test web services?
msgSnippet: Isnt HttpUnit most suitable functional testing for a web UI rather than web services which do not have any UI and are really an EAI (enterprise application
messageBody:
Isnt HttpUnit most suitable functional testing for a web UI rather
than web services which do not have any UI and are really an EAI
(enterprise application integration) technology?

I do not know what framework would apply very well to testing web
services... Though I cannot try not to think of web services in terms
of the request response paradigm of HTTP.



On Sun, 9 Jan 2005 08:20:53 -0800 (PST), Harbir Singh Hundal
<hshundal@...> wrote:
>
> Hello!!!
> I reallu do not undesrstand by what do u mean by
> webservice, but in case you mean webapplication, u can
> use HTTPUNIT to test the webapplication.
> --- Jirong Hu <hujirong888@...> wrote:
>
> >
> >
> > Hi
> >
> > I have used JUnit to test J2EE applications, but
> > never got a chance
> > to code web services.
> >
> > How do you test web services, both for unit test and
> > integration
> > test?
> >
> > Jirong
